item.title: Course Overview
item.description: Course Overview # Important CSE students should note that CS 7641 is not allowed as a substitute for the CSE core course CSE 6740, and that they cannot get credit for both CSE 6740 and CS 7641. This course introduces techniques in machine learning with an emphasis on algorithms and their applications to real-world data. We will investigate the following question: how to computationally extract useful knowledge from data for decision making and task support!

item.title: Instructor and TAs

item.title: Course Schedule
item.description: Schedule # Important All deadline and due dates in this course will be at 23:59 ET. Scroll horizontally to see the full schedule table on mobile devices Astericks (*) indicate that the lecture slides/notes are available. Week Dates Topics Homework Quizzes Project Readings 1 1/9 - 1/13 *Course Overview (L1) *Data analysis toolbox - P1 (L2) Q0 - L1&2 GT Honor Code; Heilmeier catechism; Visual Information Theory by Chris Olah; GitHub Pages; YAML Configuration; NumPy Tutorial; Matplotlib Tutorial; seaborn: statistical data visualization; Overleaf for GT students; 2 1/16 - 1/20 *Linear Algebra (*Notes, L3) *Prob and Stats (*Notes, L4) Q1 - L3 & Syllabus Quiz Correlation vs Covariance; Linear Algebra Review by Zico Kolter; 3 1/23 - 1/27 *Prob and Stats - contd (*Notes, L5) *Info Theory (*Notes, L6) A1 out 1/23 Q2 - L4, L5,6 The Differences Between Data, Information and Knowledge Cross Entropy as loss function More about Cross Entropy and KLD; Probability Theory Review by Andrew Moore; 4 1/30 - 2/3 *Optimization (L7) *Toolbox - P2 (L8) Q3 - L7,8 Project team composition due 2/3 KKT for inequality constrained optimization; Why Cross Entropy over MSE for Classification; Gradient Descent short video; Matplotlib Tutorial; NumPy Tutorial; 5 2/6 - 2/10 *Clustering & K-Means (*Notes L9) *GMM - Part 1 (*Notes L10) A1 due 2/10 A2 out 2/10 Q4 - L9 Curse of dimensionality (Euclidean space example); Jupyter Notbook (Kmeans and DBSCAN); 6 2/13 - 2/17 *GMM - Part 2 (*Notes L11) *Hierarchical Clustering (*Notes L12) Q5 - L10,11,12 Understanding the concept of Hierarchical clustering Technique; Dendrogram Visualization; GitHub Student Application 7 2/20 - 2/24 *DB SCAN (*Notes L13) *Clustering Eval (*Notes L14) Q6 - L13,14 Project proposal due 2/24 Peer Evaluation 2/24 Jupyter Notbook (Kmeans and DBSCAN); 8 2/27 - 3/3 *Density Estimation (Notes L15) *Dimension Reduction (Notes L16) Q7 - L15,16 KDE interactive visualization; KDE sampling; KDE SKLearn and sampling; Jupyter Notebook Kernel Density Example; Image reconstruction using PCA; Feature extraction using PCA; PCA for images; PCA as linear combination of features; PCA and Linear Discriminant Analysis; 9 3/6 - 3/10 Linear Regression (Notes L17) LR contd (Notes L18) A2 due 3/10 A3 out 3/10 Q8 - L17&L18 Simple Linear Regression in Matrix Format; 10 3/13 - 3/17 Regularization (Notes L19) NB & Logistic Reg (Notes L20) Q9 - L19 Adding Noise to Regression Predictors; 11 3/20 - 3/24 Spring Break 12 3/27 - 3/31 NB & Logistic Reg (Notes L21) Project Practical Advice (Notes L22) Q10 - L20,21 Project midpoint report 3/31 AOE Peer Evaluation 3/31 AOE 13 4/3 - 4/7 Neural Networks (Notes L23) NN contd (Notes L24) A3 due 4/7 A4 out 4/7 Q11 - L23,24 NN Playground Interactive NN initialization; The role of a hidden layer; Back propagation numerical example; More detailed introduction; 14 4/10 - 4/14 CNN (Notes L25) DT and RF (Notes DT & RF, L26) Q12 - L25,26 CNN Live Demo; A guide to an efficient way to build CNN and optimize its hyper-parameters; Back Propagation in CNN; Transfer learning in CNN; Project Scoring Guidance; 15 4/17 - 4/21 SVM - Part 1 (Notes, L27) SVM - Part 2 (Notes, L28) A4 Due 4/21 Q13 - L27,28 16 4/24 - 4/25 SVM-Kernel (Notes, L29) Ethics in ML (L29) Final Class days (Apr 24 and 25) Final Project due 4/25 Peer Evaluation due 4/25 KKT and SVM
